results.title: The Last Emperor
results.creator_credit: Bernardo Bertolucci, Jeremy Thomas and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1908 three year old Pu Yi becomes Emperor of Imperial China. In the course of his life-time he will be treated as a God, become a playboy and traitor, and finally end up jailed by the communists. The end of his life is spent happily as a humble gardener. Bertolucci’s film is an astonishing visual treat, encompassing both the history of China in the twentieth century, and elegantly detailing the story of the country’s last imperial ruler. Stars John Lone, Peter O’Toole and Joan Chen. Winner of nine Academy Awards (including Best Picture). The music is by David Byrne and Ryuichi Sakamoto.

results.title: Night Moves
results.creator_credit: Arthur Penn, Robert Sherman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman plays private detective Harry Moseby who is hired by an ex- actress to find her teenage runaway daughter. Moseby’s hunt for the missing teenager takes him deep into mystery, double-cross, violence and smuggling. A homage to film-noir, “Night Moves” is also a bleak, stylish examination of alienation and greed in contemporary America.

results.title: Napoleon
results.brief_description: Acclaimed as the most accurate depiction of the life and times of Napoleon this film depicts the early beginnings, the famed love saga with Josephine, and the undisputable achievements of history’s most colourful conqueror. Filmed on location at the actual historical sites of Versailles, Fountainbleau and the Chateau of Malmaison. The star-studded cast features Orson Welles and Yves Montand.

results.title: Duel
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, George Eckstein and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: What begins as an ordinary business trip becomes a haunting life and death battle for Dennis Weaver in Steven Spielberg’s highly acclaimed first film. Initially Weaver refuses to believe he is being followed by a huge diesel truck, but soon the unbelievable horror of the situation sinks in. Based on a story by Richard Matheson who also wrote the screenplay.

results.title: The Dresser
results.brief_description: The compelling study of the intense relationship between the exhausted and aging leader of a wartime Shakespearian company, “Sir” (Albert Finney), and his homosexual dresser, Norman (Tom Courtenay). Adapted by Ronald Harwood from his own play, “The Dresser” is based on the touring career of Donald Wolfit whose dresser the author was. A film rich in comedy, compassion and love for the theatre.

results.title: Dial M for murder
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Alfred Hitchcock agreed to direct this masterful adaptation of the Broadway play by Frederick Knott merely to fulfil studio contractual obligations but “Dial M for Murder” became one of his most acclaimed thrillers. Anxious to inherit his wife’s fortune, society playboy Tony Wendice (Ray Milland) ingeniously plots her murder. Blackmailing a former associate with a criminal record, he arranges what appears to be a perfect crime. However, his scheme is foiled when Margot (Grace Kelly) stabs her attacker with scissors. Wendice must now take his sinister web of intrigue in a different direction to cover his tracks. Co-starring John Williams.

results.title: Fire over England
results.creator_credit: William K. Howard, Erich Pommer, Pendennis and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Historical drama dealing with England’s struggle against the Spanish Armada. Performances by Vivien Leigh, Laurence Olivier, Flora Robson and an early performance by James Mason. Based on the novel by A.E.W. Mason.

results.title: Another Country
results.creator_credit: Marek Kanievska, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Castlezone
results.brief_description: Guy Bennett is nearing the end of his last year at a leading English boarding school. His best friend, Tommy Judd, is a Marxist, committed to Lenin’s brave new world. In a school permeated by homosexuality, affairs between the boys are accepted, provided discretion is practised. Bennett breaks this unwritten rule and the humiliating consequences establish within him a rejection of the system that excludes him. Scripted by Julian Mitchell from his own play.

results.title: The Big Sleep
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Raymond Chandler’s novel of the same name, “The Big Sleep” stars Humphrey Bogart as Philip Marlowe, the private eye who “dares to walk the mean streets alone”. Investigating a series of gambling debts he comes across plenty of murder, blackmail, kidnapping and violence. Lauren Bacall plays opposite Bogart and the screen magic between them in this film is legendary. The witty dialogue is scripted by William Faulkner. A consummate Hollywood film noir.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning “Anne of Green Gables: the Sequel” continues the charming story of Anne Shirley, now an attractive and high spirited 18 year old teacher at Avonlea, whose life is brimming with romantic dreams, comic mishaps and adventure. Based on three books by Lucy Maud Montgomery: “Anne of Avonlea”, “Anne of the Island”, and “Anne of Windy Poplars”.
